newsitem.title: CYPRUS: British victims of Cyprus crash identified.
newsitem.headline: British victims of Cyprus crash identified.

text.p: British military authorities in Cyprus on Monday released the names of three soldiers killed in a traffic accident on Sunday.

They are staff sergeant Nathaniel McMahon, 36, from Northern Ireland, Lance Corporal Alan Vow, 31, from Wrexham, north Wales, and soldier Darren Horton, 21, from Lancashire, a member of the Kings Regiment.
A fourth soldier seriously injured in the crash is undergoing treatment at the General Hospital in the capital Nicosia. He has not been identified.
"Relatives have been flown out to be with him. He is in stable condition," a British army spokesman said.
The accident happened early on Sunday afternoon on a busy road between the British base of Dhekelia and the resort town of Ayia Napa in south eastern Cyprus. The soldiers were based in Dhekelia.

Witnesses said the soldiers' car collided with a truck coming in the opposite direction and ended up in a field, trapping the soldiers in the wreckage. All three soldiers were dead on arrival at hospital.
Around 3,700 British military personnel are serving at two bases in Cyprus.
